content.description: This short but fun moderate has a hanging start and moves into a low roof.  Pulling onto the route is the crux.  After that the only difficulty this route provides is figuring which of countless pockets and features you want to use as you move up the route.
content.protection: 3 bolts plus 2 bolt anchor with quick links
content.location: This route is just right of the massive overhanging roof section that is home to Mad Max.

content.description: Start in the back of the low roof and pull out onto the steep face with big and powerful moves to mostly good holds. Pull the crux by moving over the bulge near the top of the route and pulling onto the techy slab. Taller climbers can clip the anchors from the base of the slab without actually moving up it. Stand on a rock stack to reach the starting holds and stick clip the first bolt.
content.location: Starts on a rock stack at the base of a low roof to the left of Mad Max.

content.description: Between Mad Max and Tank girl is an obvious crack that moves up a dihedral with a large roof crack.  Once up top you can either use anchors on Tank Girl or top out and use a tree anchor
content.protection: Standard Rack.  Tree anchor or use Tank Girls anchors
content.location: Just around the corner to the right of Mad Max in an obvious crack that runs up a dihedral.

content.description: A short but sustained route with powerful moves.  Shares a start with both Mad Max and Mad Max direct but moves straight up the wall. It climbs just right of the vertical crack that starts halfway up the wall.  May be a bit tough for the grade.
content.location: Shares start with Mad Max on the low roof.

content.description: Shares the start with Mad Max and follows it on the travers on the 2nd roof, but heads straight up the headwall instead of traversing all the way out to the arete.
content.protection: Stick clip the 1st bolt.  4 bolts plus 2 bolt anchor.
content.location: Shares a start with Mad Max.  It begins near the right edge of the massive low roof system and traverses out right.

content.description: One of the most unique routes at Lincoln and the namesake route of the area. Stickclip the rightmost first bolt. Power through a low roof and make a really big move to a good ledge.  Traverse right under the next roof.  Keep moving right where the bolt line splits and finish climbing up the arete.
content.protection: Stick clip the 1st bolt.  5 bolts plus 2 bolt anchor
content.location: Near the end of the area, the route starts on the massive low roof system and traverses out right to the arete.

content.description: This intimidating route starts on a large boulder at base of cliff.  Campus the first couple of moves then use alternating heel hooks to pull the low roof.  Once above the roof, move from jug to jug up the short headwall to clip the anchors.  The highly featured face has a lot of sucker holds that can make this route seem much harder than it is.  Once you identify the jugs, you can make big move after big move to perfect jugs and buckets.
content.location: Starts on a large boulder about 25ft left of Postman.

content.description: Bring your crash pad.Quite committing line, jagged boulders on each side of fall zone.Slabby and no real hands or feet. Party on.Â
content.location: Standing at Mad Max Wall, head down hill towards the lake. The boulder stands well above all the others

content.description: This is the rightmost wall on the cliff line.  Mad Max Wall contains several short but powerful routes, including the namesake route Mad Max, which is one of the best routes Lincoln has to offer.
